text: SPOILERS. Megan Fox's absence was immensely felt throughout the entire movie, and her character was written off in the laziest way possible. There were a lot of inconsistencies throughout the movie, and a lot of stupid moments that felt completely detached from the story (even though they were really funny and enjoyable to watch). Despite this movie's shortcomings, it was still an amazing movie, and I had a lot of fun watching it. The action and visuals were incredible, and I will never get tired of hearing Peter Cullen's voice as Optimus Prime. I definitely recommend it for action, sci-fi, and combat fans, and of course for fans of the Transformers franchise!

Transformers: Dark of the Moon is a grim, self-serious, and punishingly long blockbuster with impressive visual effects, but a soulless and exhausting experience.

Highlights
- Visual Effects: The visual effects are a monumental technical achievement, with a breathtaking final battle.
- Action Sequences: The "Driller" Decepticon sequence and wingsuit action are spectacular.

Criticisms
- Poor Screenplay: The plot is convoluted, self-serious, and incoherent, with a plodding pace.
- Unlikable Characters: The human characters are at their worst, with Sam Witwicky being angry and entitled.
- Cynical Direction: Michael Bay's direction is grim, nihilistic, and devoid of wonder.

Verdict
Transformers: Dark of the Moon is a technical showcase serving a terrible movie. Its impressive visuals are overshadowed by a joyless, punishing, and forgettable experience.

Transformers: Dark of the Moon is perhaps the best Transformers movie besides Bumblebee (2018). The story is much better than Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen, with three subplots that lead up to the main plot with one of the most unexpected betrayals in cinema. Shia LaBeouf's character is developed significantly better than the last two films. Sentinel Prime is a well written villain since he has actual motives than the previous villains, and he raises the stakes higher for the Autobots. The ending is a bit messy, but led to what could've been the ending of the trilogy. Overall, Transformers: Dark of the Moon is definitely worth watching with your friends and family, it has its dumb moments, but it is thrilling for all audiences with it's ship of stunning CGI.
